summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department, transmitting discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) for whom discovery materials are being transmitted to the detention center.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials to the detention center on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Criminal Prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ongoing federal criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330) in the Southern District of New York.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal transmittal of discovery materials from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the detention center holding Ghislaine Maxwell.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of November 2020.
The criminal case against her is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, docket number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Audrey Strauss, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, was involved in the prosecution's discovery process.
The document illustrates the procedural handling of discovery in a high-profile federal criminal case.
